MAYDAY --- Oh my gosh that was funny --- I mean - really funny... People at work are coming up to figure out why I'm laughing so hard. I've had poison ivy --- so I can totally understand... LMAO!And to simonbowie... Nah... Not anymore than you would turn into a Martian if the person in front of you was from Mars.Chances are 99.9999999999999999% that you would not contract HCV from a piece of paper or anything like that.You need to have an actively bleeding opening in your skin --- and you need to have their blood getting into your blood.It's a blood borne disease.So don't panic ---- BUT --- on a side note --- FOR EVERY HUMAN BEING --- I advocate a HEP PANEL test every 2 years to 5 years.Not because we should all be afraid --- but like diabetes --- HCV or HepB or HepA can happen to ANYONE.Meki

intended...and I think you asked your question in a polite manner, and it seems legit...but I shudder to think what these poor people with AIDs go through, when they have those carposi, whatevers on their skin and it's very visible...and you still can't get AIDs by having average human contact, like touching their skin...I betcha they get a lot of creepy stares all day long....particularly if they live in areas where there is little knowledge of these diseases....oh I wish the medical professions would get their shite together and educate people about possible contact, etc with all the infections diseases...I saw that movie I Am Legend and I thought, there are probably people out there who think we're "the other" just because we have a virus, (if they know anyway) that nobody can catch unless they've traded blood with us, and I don't know about anybody else, but I don't trade blood with anybody if I can help it...lol...it's just sad...we hear about Britney's lunch plans all day long, but there are hardly any shows on this...
